scene_description_enriched: The scene depicts Saint Luke painting the Virgin Mary and Christ Child. Saint Luke, identified by his halo and beard, is seated and actively painting on a panel, holding a brush and palette. He is dressed in a green tunic and a pink robe. To his left, within a golden, arched shrine, is an image of the Virgin Mary holding the Christ Child. In the background, to the left, the ox, Saint Luke's traditional symbol, is visible. To the right, a window with blue panes is depicted, and a jug sits on a surface. The floor is a checkered pattern of yellow and blue squares. The scene is framed by an ornate, gilded border with floral motifs.
scene_interpretation: Saint Luke painting the Virgin and Child
